resources.string: Welcome to New York City! New York City is a dazzling place unlike any other filled with tons of history and culture. NYC is comprised of five boroughs; Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens, The Bronx and Staten Island. There is something to do in every borough. How would you like to explore?

Located in Lower Manhattan, One World Trade center was built as a part of reconstruction efforts after the Twin Towers were destroyed during the 9/11 terror attacks. Construction on One WTC, or the "Freedom Tower" as its known to locals, began in 2007 and it opened to the public in 2015. One WTC stands at a whopping 104 stories high (1776 feet) and is the tallest building in the Western Hemisphere.\n\n
(Source: oneworldobservatory.com)

The Museum of the Moving Image credits itself as being the only museum in the United States dedicated to exploring the art, history and technology of the moving image. The Museum of the Moving Image originally opened back 1988, but was revamped 2011 to include stunning new screening rooms that accommodate twice as many visitors. Perfect for kids and adults alike, MoMI is a fun, informative and inviting place for museum-goers around the world.\n\n
(Source: movingimage.us)

Prospect Park was designed Frederick Law Olmsted and Calvert Vaux in the mid-19th century and is the second largest park in Brooklyn. Although, it is not the biggest park in NYC (526 acres), there is certainly much to do. Prospect Park has 11 tennis courts, 7 baseball fields, 4 hiking trails, horseback riding, an ice skating rink and is home to the famous Prospect Park Botanical Garden and Prospect Park Zoo. It is no wonder this park welcomes 10 million visitors a year.\n\n
(Source: prospectpark.org)
